questions.title: Question 1: What is the primary focus of mobile robotics?
options: b. Enabling robots to move through their environment
questions.explanation: The primary focus of mobile robotics is enabling robots to move through their environment autonomously or semi-autonomously.

questions.title: Question 2: Which sensor is commonly used for obstacle detection in mobile robots?
questions.explanation: Ultrasonic sensors are commonly used in mobile robots for obstacle detection by emitting sound waves and measuring the time it takes for the echo to return.

questions.title: Question 3: What is SLAM in the context of mobile robotics?
questions.explanation: SLAM stands for Simultaneous Localization and Mapping, a technique used by mobile robots to build a map of an unknown environment while simultaneously keeping track of their location within it.

questions.title: Question 4: What is the main challenge in robotic manipulation and grasping?
options: c. Accurately grasping and manipulating objects
questions.explanation: The main challenge in robotic manipulation and grasping is accurately grasping and manipulating objects of varying shapes, sizes, and weights.

questions.title: Question 5: Which of the following is an example of an end effector used in robotic manipulation?
questions.explanation: A gripper is an example of an end effector used in robotic manipulation to grasp and manipulate objects.

questions.title: Question 6: What role do force sensors play in robotic manipulation?
options: a. They provide power to the robot
b. They measure the force applied by the robot during manipulation
questions.explanation: Force sensors measure the force applied by the robot during manipulation, providing feedback to ensure precise and safe handling of objects.

questions.title: Question 7: What is human-robot interaction (HRI)?
options: a. Robots interacting with other robots
b. Robots interacting with humans in various contexts
c. Robots moving in an environment
questions.explanation: Human-robot interaction (HRI) refers to the study and practice of robots interacting with humans in various contexts, including communication, collaboration, and coexistence.

questions.title: Question 8: Why is safety a critical consideration in human-robot interaction?
options: b. To prevent damage to the robot
c. To ensure that humans are not harmed during interactions
questions.explanation: Safety is a critical consideration in human-robot interaction to ensure that humans are not harmed during interactions with robots.

questions.title: Question 9: Which technology is often used to enable natural language communication in human-robot interaction?
questions.explanation: Natural Language Processing (NLP) is used to enable natural language communication in human-robot interaction, allowing robots to understand and respond to human speech.

questions.title: Question 10: What is the primary goal of multi-robot systems?
options: a. To improve individual robot performance
b. To enable robots to work together to achieve common goals
c. To reduce the size of robots
questions.explanation: The primary goal of multi-robot systems is to enable robots to work together to achieve common goals, leveraging the capabilities of multiple robots for complex tasks.

questions.title: Question 11: Which of the following is a common application of multi-robot systems?
questions.explanation: A common application of multi-robot systems is search and rescue missions, where multiple robots can work together to cover large areas and locate survivors more efficiently.

questions.title: Question 12: What is one of the main challenges in coordinating multi-robot systems?
options: b. Communication and coordination among robots
questions.explanation: One of the main challenges in coordinating multi-robot systems is ensuring effective communication and coordination among robots to achieve the desired collective behavior.
